reason: C&D sprinter back to a straight 5f with a strong jockey booking; well-treated on peak figures and profiles as a solid top‑3 player at a price.
Pacey 5f handicapper who maps handy in a big-field dash; consistent Class 2 form and workable mark give him a live place/win chance.
Unexposed 3yo stepping up in trip with improvement to come; stable excels with this profile and an 8‑runner Classic H’cap sets up each‑way.
Strong finisher suited by Redcar’s straight mile; pace looks solid and his best turf figures put him right in the frame at double‑digits.
Proven 5f handicapper who goes well in strongly-run dashes; mark workable and shape of the race promises a late run into the places.
Reliable 5f performer with track form; a strong early pace should suit his stalking style and makes him an each‑way player.
Last‑time‑out Class 3 6f winner (Chester) with a strong travelling style that suits a straight‑track sprint; arrives in form and maps for a stalk‑and‑pounce run in a big‑field dash.
Excellent recent Ascot mile run (5th of 17 in a deeper C2) shows he handles track, tempo and trip; drawn to get cover and finish late in a race that should set up for closers.
Reliable 5f sprinter with solid recent placings; tactically versatile and proven to see the trip well at this level, which is key on the Curragh 5f when the pace holds up.
Course‑and‑distance winner with consistent 6f figures; draws ok to track the middle groups and represents a tough, placey profile for big 6f Curragh handicaps.
In‑form 3m chaser (form 1‑1‑6‑2) with proven stamina; recent Wexford second reads well and this track’s rhythm suits prominent, sound jumpers—live top‑3 chance.
